--- title: "1 — Count words" date: "2024-01-02" date-modified: last-modified image: "three.jpg" format: html: toc: true warning: false message: false fig-width: 2 tbl-colwidths: [25,75] categories: [code, words, terms, count] --- ## Load the data ::: {.cell hash='index_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-1_af029442598b905bfaaf5e8419733105'} ```{.r .cell-code} library(tidyverse) tv_ratings <- read_csv('https://raw.githubusercontent.com/rfordatascience/tidytuesday/master/data/2021/2021-04-20/netflix_titles.csv') ``` ::: ## Count totals of each type ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} library(tidyverse) library(kableExtra) type_count <- tv_ratings %>% count(type) type_count ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 2 × 2 type n 1 Movie 5377 2 TV Show 2410 ``` ::: ::: ## Count totals of each type by release_year ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} year_type_count <- tv_ratings %>% count(release_year, type) year_type_count %>% head() ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 6 × 3 release_year type n 1 1925 TV Show 1 2 1942 Movie 2 3 1943 Movie 3 4 1944 Movie 3 5 1945 Movie 3 6 1946 Movie 1 ``` ::: ::: ## Results in a wide table with totals ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} library(janitor) tv_ratings %>% tabyl(release_year, type) %>% filter(release_year < 1960) %>% adorn_totals() %>% knitr::kable() ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} `````{=html}

````` ::: ::: ## Rank occurence of words > `tokens` = words or phrases Top **10** words in the show's genre description. ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} library(tidytext) word_count <- tv_ratings %>% unnest_tokens(word, listed_in) %>% count(word) %>% arrange(-n) %>% head(10) word_count ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 10 × 2 word n 1 movies 4989 2 tv 4972 3 international 3636 4 dramas 2810 5 shows 2612 6 comedies 1996 7 action 871 8 adventure 871 9 romantic 864 10 documentaries 786 ``` ::: ::: ## Exclude stop words / unwanted words > `stop words` = Common words or phrases that don't provide value ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} word_count <- tv_ratings %>% unnest_tokens(word, listed_in) %>% count(word) %>% arrange(-n) %>% head(10) word_count ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 10 × 2 word n 1 movies 4989 2 tv 4972 3 international 3636 4 dramas 2810 5 shows 2612 6 comedies 1996 7 action 871 8 adventure 871 9 romantic 864 10 documentaries 786 ``` ::: :::
